about.summary: A Pulsar Timing Package, written in Python from scratch

name: pint-pulsar
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pint-pulsar" %}
{% set version = "0.6.3" %}

package:
  name: "{{ name|lower }}"
  version: "{{ version }}"

source:
  url: "https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz"
  sha256: 3ab01cb3d7f6ddbad9fd62a7e7f4049105fbffa326d193d7fed1ba3e66408dae

build:
  number: 0
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv"
  skip: true  # [py27]
  skip: true  # [win]
# Add [skip appveyor] to commit messages to prevent windows from starting at all

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python
    - setuptools

  run:
    - python
    - numpy >=1.16
    - astropy >=3.2,<=4.0
    - scipy >=0.18.1
    - jplephem >=2.6
    - matplotlib-base >=1.5.3
    - emcee >=3.0
    - corner >=2.0.1
    - uncertainties

# The PyPI package "pint" is a units package whose package name conflicts with ours so they must not both be installed
# This should prevent that
  run_constrained:
    - pint ==9999999999

test:
  imports:
    - pint

about:
  home: https://github.com/nanograv/PINT
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE.md
  summary: "A Pulsar Timing Package, written in Python from scratch"
  doc_url: https://nanograv-pint.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
  dev_url: https://github.com/nanograv/PINT

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - paulray
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
